DOC.brief_summary: Purpose: To evaluate if lifestyle intervention (diet and exercise) can reduce maternal weight gain, the incidence of pregnancy complications and minimize the number of macrosomic infants.
DOC.brief_title: Effect of Intervention With Diet and Physical Activity in Obese Pregnant Women
DOC.detailed_description: Obese pregnant women with a BMI>30 are randomized to Diet + Exercise, Exercise or control (1:1:1) in order to reduce maternal weight gain to less than 5 kg during pregnancy. The effect on the children of mothers in this study is evaluated in the study: Is it possible to reduce the Number of Macrosomic Infants With Abundant Fat Tissue by Lifestyle Intervention during Pregnancy (NCT01235676)
DOC.criteria: Age >18 years BMI > 30 Singleton pregnancy Must speak and understand Danish Alcohol or drug abuse Diabetes type I or other critical medical disease.
